ratings.comment: One of the best courses I've ever taken. I thought it was going to be hopelessly boring, but man I was wrong. The readings were pretty long and you HAVE to read them to pass, but they are usually interesting (sometimes not). No pressure of exams - it's all essay based. Only three 3-4 page papers and an online response post each week. Take it!

Professor Schatzberg is a great professor. He clearly enjoys what he teaches and has a passion for the topics. Definitely expect a lot of reading though. Most of the readings are interesting, but some can be dry. He took a lot of our feedback to heart, and may change the more dry readings. Would for sure recommend him as a professor!

I am very pleased with this class. He assigns three 3-4 page essays instead of exams, and I feel that really helped me apply the material instead of memorize it. Is it an "easy-A?" - nah, you work for your A. However, there is not a lot of pressure that would be typical in an exam-based class. Lectures are interesting and I highly recommend it.

One of the best professors at Madison IMO. Would suggest this course to anyone. Is really clear in lectures and for the most part on grading, and always gives amble opportunity for kids to do well in the class. It can be a lot of reading but most of the material was really engaging and interesting anyway. Lots of writing but most are 1pgers

Professor Schatzberg is really passionate about the subjects he speaks about. He is energetic in lectures which make the boring subjects a little easier to listen to. No midterms or final just three (3-4 page) papers. The TA Stephen was a tough grader on the papers but he said if you show improvement over the semester, your grade will reflect.
Lectures are engaging, and actually very interesting. Reading assignments are not boring and correlate with discussion in lecture. I recommend this class!
Lectures are engaging and helpful for discussion. Some of the readings are long, but meaningful as a whole. Easy class.

The readings are long and insanely boring. Looking back the topics are incredibly dry, but Professor Schatzberg has the ability to make even the driest subjects seem interesting. He is very clear and does an amazing job engaging students. He is easily one of the best professors on campus
TAKE IT. just 3 simple papers (50%) and discussion (50%). topics are fairly interesting as they relate to modern history (Ford, space shuttles, etc). not a hard class at all.

This class had ups and downs. The research project/paper (15-20 pages) was fine. Schatz takes plenty of steps to make sure your paper will be pretty good, and you get to pick your topic from a big topic (ours was Autos). He lectured on every aspect of writing a paper extensively though. Not a hard class, but tough to sit through for 2 hours/wk!

Awesome professor. Readings are definitely mandatory, but most of them were only 10-15 pages once a week (x2 readings). Lectures were mostly very interesting, particularly the bit on the Space Shuttle. Our TA was a bit quiet but our discussion got along pretty well. Great professor - cool class. No exams, just three essays (all were pretty basic).

Great professor who really knows his stuff. If you're a honors student looking for an easy three credits, take his HS180 course. It's pretty interesting, there are no tests, and the writing assignments aren't too difficult. Just participate in class and read (most of) the material and you'll get an A.

Professor Schatzberg brings enthusiasm to everyone of his classes. The readings are engaging and class discussions/short essays are thought provoking. There are no tests in this class, only short reading responses.

For someone who doesn't care too much for history or science courses, I've really enjoyed this course. He really wants you to understand the material and is more than happy to entertain questions until you comprehend the topic. Course consisted of 3 essay exams and that's it. Also a definite plus!
Great professor! He really knows his stuff and is passionate about the subject, which makes the students care more. Subjects were incredibly interesting. I'd recommend him without question!

Definitely one of my favorite profs.  (Only my Kendo instructor was better, but that's because he was paranoid and talked about waffles a lot.)  Schatzberg is very eloquent, seems to love the subject, cares about his students, gives plenty of feedback, and gives the class breaks during power lectures.  Now, if only I could read his writing!

One of the best profs I've had. Taught material with that rare passion that follows true competency in the subject. Very interesting material, lectures, and discussions. This was the greatest class I've taken in college. Take it, you'll love it (as of now, only he teaches it).
